name: Rogue Poison
desc: These poisons deal 1d4 poison damage. Only you can apply these poisons properly, and they expire the next time you prepare.

name: Arsenic
desc: This toxin is a compound of arsenic and other substances. You can't reduce your sickened condition while affected.

name: Spear Frog Poison
desc: A single spear frog yields enough toxin to Craft 1 dose of spear frog poison.

name: Giant Centipede Venom
desc: Giant centipede venom causes severe muscle stiffness.
stages/3: 1d12 poison damage, clumsy 1, and flat-footed (1 round)

name: Black Smear Poison
desc: Many calignis use a debilitating poison crafted from subterranean fungi.

name: Belladonna
desc: Sometimes called “deadly nightshade,” belladonna is a widely available toxin produced from a plant similar to a tomato.
stages/3: 1d6 poison damage, confused, and sickened 1 (1 minute)

name: Black Adder Venom
desc: Adder venom is a simple but effective way to enhance a weapon.

name: Toad Tears
desc: Toad tears can be mixed with any other foodstuff or drink, but the poison can also be ingested as is. The process of refining giant toad poison lessens its deadly qualities, and as a result, toad tears are rarely directly fatal. Yet those who are exposed to toad tears often lose control of their actions, making it a dangerous poison nevertheless.

name: Lethargy Poison
desc: Lethargy poison is commonly used in hit-and-run tactics by drow and others who want their victims alive; the ambusher retreats until the poison sets in and the victim falls unconscious. Further exposure to lethargy poison does not require the target to attempt additional saving throws; only failing an saving throw against an ongoing exposure can progress its stage.
stages/3: unconscious with no Perception check to wake up (1 round)
stages/4: unconscious with no Perception check to wake up (1d4 hours).

name: Yellow Musk Vial
desc: The powdered pollen from a yellow musk creeper addles the mind.
stages/1: fascinated by the poison cloud (1 round)
stages/2: fascinated by the poison cloud, and can use no actions but to move closer to the cloud's point of origin (1 round)

name: Blue Dragonfly Poison
desc: Boggards brew a potent toxin made from blue dragonflies. Swampseers consume this mixture to awaken their divine powers, but the poison inspires crippling hallucinations in most other creatures.

name: Cytillesh Oil
desc: This thick substance is distilled from the mind-robbing cytillesh fungus, though it lacks memory-altering capabilities.

name: Graveroot
desc: The opaque white sap from the graveroot shrub clouds the mind.

name: Violet Venom
desc: The delicate process of extracting violet venom from a violet fungus leaves it diluted at the best of times. Alchemists are still on the hunt for a truly pure, unadulterated version of this highly toxic poison.

name: Hunting Spider Venom
desc: This venom erodes its target's defenses, aiding the spider in securing prey.
stages/2: 1d12 poison damage, clumsy 1, and flat-footed (1 round)
stages/3: 2d6 poison damage, clumsy 2, and flat-footed (1 round)

name: False Death
desc: Typically used to fake one's death, this poison swiftly causes the imbiber to lose consciousness and suppresses vital signs. A creature examining the unconscious target must succeed at a Medicine check against the imbiber's Deception DC + 4 to determine that the target is alive, and a critical success allows the examiner to determine that a toxin is causing the effect. The false death toxin has an extremely bitter taste (Perception DC 10 to detect), making it difficult to trick a creature into consuming the poison against its wishes.

name: Giant Scorpion Venom
desc: Scorpion venom is excruciating and its effects are somewhat debilitating.

name: Giant Wasp Venom
desc: Giant wasp venom interferes with a victim's movement.

name: Malyass Root Paste
desc: Malyass root paste sees use to impede opponents in athletic competitions, in addition to espionage and tracking.
stages/1: clumsy 1 and -10-foot status penalty to all Speeds (1 minute)
stages/2: clumsy 2 and -20-foot status penalty to all Speeds (1 minute)
stages/3: clumsy 3, flat-footed, and -30-foot status penalty to all Speeds

name: Isolation Draught
desc: Derived from steeping toxic highland plum pits in refined grain alcohols, this clear tonic slowly shuts down the imbiber's senses.
stages/1: dazzled, -3 to all Perception checks (1 minute)
stages/2: dazzled, deafened, -5 to all Perception checks (1 minute)
stages/3: blinded, deafened, -5 to all Perception checks (5 minutes)

name: Addlebrain
desc:
Certain Scarlet Triad poisoners use toxins like addlebrain to keep captured prisoners docile and compliant for short periods of time until they can be properly shackled and imprisoned. Addlebrain is distilled from a hallucinogenic lichen that can often be found growing in the sewers below particularly large cities like Katapesh.

Once soaked in special reagents and then dried, a dose of addlebrain must be either lit with flame or tossed into a fire to activate, whereupon it unleashes a cloud of toxin as normal for an inhaled poison.

name: Nettleweed Residue
desc: Concentrated sap of stinging weeds makes an effective toxin.

name: Wyvern Poison
desc: Properly harvested and preserved, the poison from a wyvern's sting is effective and direct.

name: Lich Dust
desc: Dust salvaged from the remains of a destroyed lich has paralytic properties that make it a valuable poison.
stages/3: 5d6 poison damage, fatigued, and paralyzed (1 minute)

name: Spider Root
desc: A paste made by mashing the fine, threadlike roots of a certain creeper vine, spider root renders a victim clumsy and maladroit.

name: Wolfsbane
desc: Wolfsbane appears in folklore for its link to werecreatures. If you are afflicted with lycanthropy and survive Stage 3 of wolfsbane, you're immediately cured of the lycanthropy.

name: Shadow Essence
desc: Distilled from the Plane of Shadow, this oily substance imposes tenebrous effects. The enfeebled condition from shadow essence lasts for 24 hours.
stages/1: 3d6 negative damage and 2d6 poison damage (1 round)
stages/2: 3d6 negative damage, 2d6 poison damage, and enfeebled 1 (1 round)
stages/3: 3d6 negative damage, 2d6 poison damage, and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

name: Blightburn Resin
desc: This tacky, hardened sap is harvested from trees infected by fungal blights and exposed to open flames.

name: Slumber Wine
desc: Slumber wine sees its greatest use in games of intrigue, where an absence can be more devastating than injury. Characters unconscious from slumber wine can't wake up by any means while the poison lasts, don't need to eat or drink while unconscious in this way, and appear to be recently dead unless an examiner succeeds at a DC 40 Medicine check.

name: Mage Bane
desc: Upon being mixed and injected into the bloodstream, this powder of the crimson orchid quickly assaults the brain and nerves, disrupting the victim's ability to piece together coherent thoughts and spells.

name: Deathcap Powder
desc: The toxic deathcap mushroom can be dried, ground, and treated to form a flavorless powder with accelerated effects.

name: Gorgon's Breath
desc: Gorgon's breath is a fine powder that can easily enter living creatures' bloodstreams through their lungs before binding to mucous membranes and causing any nearby soft tissues to harden.

name: Purple Worm Venom
desc: Venom from enormous purple worms leaves a victim weakened.

name: Dragon Bile
desc: A mix of digestive juices and green dragon poison glands nauseates the victim as its flesh is digested from within.

name: Mindfog Mist
desc: Mindfog mist can be used to undermine spellcasters, as its effect on a victim's mental faculties are swift and powerful.

name: Nightmare Vapor
desc: Purportedly sourced from any number of outlandish locales, nightmare vapor is most often created by boiling the sweat collected from humanoids caught in the throes of terrible nightmares.

name: Weeping Midnight
desc: Alchemists have refined the devastatingly allergenic pollen of the widow orchid to create this venom, which swiftly causes the victim's eyes to leak mucus and swell shut.
stages/2: 7d6 poison damage, dazzled, and sickened 1 (1 round)

name: Brimstone Fumes
desc: Fumes from the forges of Hell drain health and strength alike.

name: Frenzy Oil
desc: This oil, which is pressed from vrock spores and mixed with a combination of acacia ash and thistle seeds, seeps into the skin of living creatures, initially inspiring irritability that unpredictably manifests as berserk rage.
stages/1: 4d6 mental damage, quickened 1, attack nearby creatures as if confused (1 round)
stages/2: 6d6 mental damage, attack nearby creatures as if confused (1 round)
stages/3: 8d6 mental damage, fatigued, attack nearby creatures as if confused (1 round)

name: Hemlock
desc: Concentrated hemlock is a particularly deadly toxin that halts muscle action - including that of the victim's heart.

name: King's Sleep
desc: King's sleep is an insidious long-term poison that can seem like a disease or even death from natural causes on a venerable target. The drained condition from king's sleep is cumulative with each failed save and can't be removed while the poison lasts.

name: Black Lotus Extract
desc: Black lotus extract causes severe internal bleeding.

name: Oblivion Essence
desc: Created from a daemon's powdered soul gems or refined from the waters of Abaddon's rivers, oblivion essence causes victims to rapidly age and decay.
stages/2: 10d6 poison damage, enfeebled 2, and slowed 1 (1 round)

name: Tears of Death
desc: Tears of death are among the most powerful of alchemical poisons, distilled from extracts of five other deadly poisons in just the right ratios.

name: Nightmare Salt
desc: This potent poison consists of crystals whose flavor and appearance mimics edible salt but whose effects are deadly: victims experience periods of waking nightmares that overload the senses and eventually result in death through a combination of shock and exhaustion.
stages/1: frightened 2 once every 1d4 hours, plus fatigued (1 day)
stages/2: confused for 1 minute once every 1d4 hours, plus frightened 3 and fatigued (1 day)
stages/3: frightened 3, plus confused for 1d4 minutes, once every hour, plus fatigued (1 day)
